ygData.subject: Re: Hi everyone
ygData.msgSnippet: ... same ... hotbox. I would ve absolutely LOVED to!  As it stood, I didn t do any ceremonies.  At that time it was discouraged for a guide to do them (or at
ygData.messageBody:
--- In EQ_rainbow@egroups.com, Christina Norman <tina@a...> wrote:

> Yay gay guides! =) I'm a (retired) guide on Rodcet Nife. Yes, the
same
> place as the guild. Did you see the thread on whether or not guides
> should be required to perform gay marriages in EQ? That was sure a
hotbox.

I would've absolutely LOVED to! As it stood, I didn't do any
ceremonies. At that time it was discouraged for a guide to do them
(or at least COMMIT to doing one). And until guides become paid
employees and/or receive sensitivity training, I'd be frightened of
the possibilities :) Although the guides I had on the team were very
cool.


> > recovered from burn-out (which is why my ranger is only 28).
Other
>
> Ah burnout. I haven't posted here about it, but I'm sure burned
out on
> EQ! I have a 54 Enchanter and a 52 Ranger on Brell Serilis. I quit
about
> two months ago (maybe three?) deciding I just didn't enjoy the game
that
> much any more. Politics was probably a large part of that (I hate
> politics, SIGH). I might try coming back and guiding but I don't
want to
> do that unless I'm ready to make a commitment, I don't want to
leave again
> after a couple of weeks.

Hmm.. you quit two months ago? Give it about another month - you'll
start getting cravings. Then add another month on that to let the
cravings kick in.. you'll be back ;) when I came back I did not
pursue the guiding. I am now strictly PC only (although playing
Lanys T'Vyl was fun .. and Dad said community theatre would get me
nowhere hehe).

Eric
